class.name: Nesting Information
class.description: Nesting Information tags are tags that usually contain any other tags.

class.name: Organization Information
class.description: All tags in this section express hierarchy defined in (#target-types-parts).

class.name: Nested Information
class.description: Nested Information tags are tags providing information about their parent tags.

class.name: Temporal Information
class.description: All tags in this section use the Date format defined in (#date-tags-formatting).

class.name: User Information
class.description: All tags in this section are personal to the user of these files.

class.name: Technical Information
class.description: These tags represent values that could be parsed to handle the playback better. For historical reasons they are usually stored as strings but a stricter binary format is **RECOMMENDED** for new tags.

tag.name: ORIGINAL
tag.description: A special tag that is meant to have other tags inside (using nested tags) to describe the original work of art that this item is based on.

tag.name: SAMPLE
tag.description: A tag that contains other tags to describe a sample used in the targeted item originally found in another work of art.

tag.name: COUNTRY
tag.description: The name of the country that is meant to have other tags inside (using nested tags) with country specific information about the item, using the Country Code format defined in (#country-code-tags-formatting).

tag.name: TOTAL_PARTS
tag.description: Total number of parts defined at the first lower level. (e.g., if `TargetTypeValue` is "50" (`TargetType` = "ALBUM"), the total number of tracks of an audio CD).

tag.name: PART_NUMBER
tag.description: Index of the current part relative to parts of the same level, starting at 1. (e.g., if `TargetTypeValue` is "30" (`TargetType` = "TRACK"), the track number of an audio CD).

tag.name: PART_OFFSET
tag.description: A number to add to "PART_NUMBER", when the parts at that level don't start at 1 (e.g., if `TargetTypeValue` is "30" (`TargetType` = "TRACK"), the track number of the second audio CD).

tag.name: TITLE
tag.description: The title of this item. For example, for music you might label this "Canon in D", or for video's audio track you might use "English 5.1" This is akin to the "TIT2" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: SUBTITLE
tag.description: Sub Title of the entity. This is akin to the "TIT3" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: URL
tag.description: URL corresponding to the tag it is included in, using the format defined in [@!RFC3986].

tag.name: SORT_WITH
tag.description: A child `SimpleTag` element to indicate what alternative value the parent `SimpleTag` element can have to be sorted -- for example, "Pet Shop Boys" instead of "The Pet Shop Boys". Or "Marley Bob" and "Marley Robert Nesta" (no comma needed).

tag.name: INSTRUMENTS
tag.description: The instruments that are being used/played, separated by a comma. It **MUST** be a child of another tag, including the following: "ARTIST", "LEAD_PERFORMER", or "ACCOMPANIMENT".

tag.name: EMAIL
tag.description: Email corresponding to the tag it is included in, using the "Addr-Spec" format defined in [@!RFC5322, section 3.4.1].

tag.name: ADDRESS
tag.description: The physical address of the entity. The address **MAY** include a country code. If a country code is included, it is **RECOMMENDED** to use the Country Code format defined in (#country-code-tags-formatting). It can be useful for a recording label.

tag.name: FAX
tag.description: The fax number corresponding to the tag it is included in. It can be useful for a recording label.

tag.name: PHONE
tag.description: The phone number corresponding to the tag it is included in. It can be useful for a recording label.

tag.name: ARTIST
tag.description: A person or band/collective generally considered responsible for the work. This is akin to the "TPE1" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: LEAD_PERFORMER
tag.description: Lead Performer/Soloist(s). This can sometimes be the same as "ARTIST". This is akin to the "TPE1" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: ACCOMPANIMENT
tag.description: Band/orchestra/accompaniment/musician. This is akin to the "TPE2" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: COMPOSER
tag.description: The name of one composer of this item. This is akin to the "TCOM" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: ARRANGER
tag.description: The name of a person who arranged the piece (e.g., Ravel).

tag.name: LYRICS
tag.description: The lyrics corresponding to a song, in case audio synchronization is not known or as a duplicate of a subtitle track. Editing this value, when it is a duplicate of a subtitle track, **SHOULD** also result in editing the subtitle track for more consistency, and vice versa.

tag.name: LYRICIST
tag.description: The name of a person who wrote the lyrics for a musical item. This is akin to the "TEXT" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: CONDUCTOR
tag.description: Conductor/performer refinement. This is akin to the "TPE3" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: DIRECTOR
tag.description: The name of a director of a movie. This is akin to the "IART" tag [@?RIFF.tags].

tag.name: ASSISTANT_DIRECTOR
tag.description: The name of the assistant director.

tag.name: DIRECTOR_OF_PHOTOGRAPHY
tag.description: The name of the director of photography, also known as cinematographer. This is akin to the "ICNM" tag in [@?RIFF.tags].

tag.name: SOUND_ENGINEER
tag.description: The name of the sound engineer or sound recordist.

tag.name: ART_DIRECTOR
tag.description: The person who oversees the artists and craftspeople who build the sets.

tag.name: PRODUCTION_DESIGNER
tag.description: Artist responsible for designing the overall visual appearance of a movie.

tag.name: CHOREGRAPHER
tag.description: The name of the choreographer.

tag.name: COSTUME_DESIGNER
tag.description: The name of the costume designer.

tag.name: ACTOR
tag.description: An actor or actress playing a role in this movie. This is the person's real name, not the character's name the person is playing.

tag.name: CHARACTER
tag.description: The name of the character an actor or actress plays in this movie. This **SHOULD** be a sub-tag of an `ACTOR` tag in order to not cause ambiguities.

tag.name: WRITTEN_BY
tag.description: The author of the story or script (used for movies and TV shows).

tag.name: SCREENPLAY_BY
tag.description: The author of the screenplay or scenario (used for movies and TV shows).

tag.name: EDITED_BY
tag.description: The name of a film editor for a movie. This is akin to the "IEDT" tag in [@?RIFF.tags].

tag.name: PRODUCER
tag.description: The name of a producer for a song/movie. This is akin to the "IPRO" tag in [@?RIFF.tags].

tag.name: COPRODUCER
tag.description: The name of a co-producer.

tag.name: EXECUTIVE_PRODUCER
tag.description: The name of an executive producer.

tag.name: DISTRIBUTED_BY
tag.description: The name of a company distributing the content. This is akin to the "IDST" tag in [@?RIFF.tags].

tag.name: MASTERED_BY
tag.description: The engineer who mastered the content for a physical medium or for digital distribution.

tag.name: ENCODED_BY
tag.description: This is akin to the "TENC" tag in [@!ID3v2.3].

tag.name: MIXED_BY
tag.description: DJ mix by the artist specified.

tag.name: REMIXED_BY
tag.description: Interpreted, remixed, or otherwise modified by. This is akin to the "TPE4" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: PRODUCTION_STUDIO
tag.description: The name of a physical studio where the content was recorded. This is akin to the "ISTD" tag in [@?RIFF.tags].

tag.name: THANKS_TO
tag.description: A very general tag for everyone else that wants to be listed.

tag.name: PUBLISHER
tag.description: This is akin to the "TPUB" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: LABEL
tag.description: The record label or imprint on the disc.

tag.name: GENRE
tag.description: The main genre (classical, ambient-house, synthpop, sci-fi, drama, etc.). The format follows the "TCON" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: MOOD
tag.description: Intended to reflect the mood of the item with a few keywords (e.g., "Romantic", "Sad" or "Uplifting"). The format follows that of the "TMOO" tag in [@!ID3v2.4] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: ORIGINAL_MEDIA_TYPE
tag.description: Describes the original type of the media, such as, "DVD", "CD", "computer image," "drawing," "lithograph," and so forth. This is akin to the "TMED" tag in [@!ID3v2.4].

tag.name: CONTENT_TYPE
tag.description: The type of the item (e.g., Documentary, Feature Film, Cartoon, Music Video, Music, Sound FX).

tag.name: SUBJECT
tag.description: Describes the topic of the file, such as "Aerial view of Seattle."

tag.name: DESCRIPTION
tag.description: A short description of the content, such as "Two birds flying."

tag.name: KEYWORDS
tag.description: Keywords to the item separated by a comma, used for searching.

tag.name: SUMMARY
tag.description: A plot outline or a summary of the story.

tag.name: SYNOPSIS
tag.description: A description of the story line of the item.

tag.name: INITIAL_KEY
tag.description: The initial key that a musical track starts in. The format is identical to "TKEY" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: PERIOD
tag.description: Describes the period that the piece is from or about. For example, "Renaissance".

tag.name: LAW_RATING
tag.description: Depending on the "COUNTRY" it is the format of the rating of a movie (P, R, X in the USA, an age in other countries or a URI defining a logo).

tag.name: DATE_RELEASED
tag.description: The time that the item was originally released. This is akin to the "TDRL" tag in [@!ID3v2.4] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: DATE_RECORDED
tag.description: The time that the recording began. This is akin to the "TDRC" tag in [@!ID3v2.4] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: DATE_ENCODED
tag.description: The time that the encoding of this item was completed began. This is akin to the "TDEN" tag in [@!ID3v2.4] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: DATE_TAGGED
tag.description: The time that the tags were done for this item. This is akin to the "TDTG" tag in [@!ID3v2.4] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: DATE_DIGITIZED
tag.description: The time that the item was transferred to a digital medium. This is akin to the "IDIT" tag in [@?RIFF.tags].

tag.name: DATE_WRITTEN
tag.description: The time that the writing of the music/script began.

tag.name: DATE_PURCHASED
tag.description: Information on when the file was purchased; see also (#commercial) on purchase tags.

tag.name: DATE_STARTED
tag.description: When the information of the parent `SimpleTag` element starts being valid. The information of the parent `SimpleTag` element is only valid between this date and the "DATE_ENDED" date of the same level. The "DATE_ENDED" is **OPTIONAL**. If empty or omitted the end date is unknown.

tag.name: DATE_ENDED
tag.description: When the information is not valid anymore. The information of the parent `SimpleTag` element is only valid between the "DATE_STARTED" date of the same level and this date. The "DATE_STARTED" is **OPTIONAL**. If empty or omitted the start date is unknown.

tag.name: RECORDING_LOCATION
tag.description: The location where the item was recorded, using the Country Code format defined in (#country-code-tags-formatting). This code is followed by a comma, then more detailed information such as state/province, another comma, and then city. For example, "US, Texas, Austin". This will allow for easy sorting. It is okay to only store the country, or the country and the state/province. More detailed information can be added after the city through the use of additional commas. In cases where the province/state is unknown, but you want to store the city, simply leave a space between the two commas. For example, "US, , Austin".

tag.name: COMPOSITION_LOCATION
tag.description: Location that the item was originally designed/written, using the Country Code format defined in (#country-code-tags-formatting). This code is followed by a comma, then more detailed information such as state/province, another comma, and then city. For example, "US, Texas, Austin". This will allow for easy sorting. It is okay to only store the country, or the country and the state/province. More detailed information can be added after the city through the use of additional commas. In cases where the province/state is unknown, but you want to store the city, simply leave a space between the two commas. For example, "US, , Austin".

tag.name: COMPOSER_NATIONALITY
tag.description: Nationality of the main composer of the item, mostly for classical music, using the Country Code format defined in (#country-code-tags-formatting).

tag.name: COMMENT
tag.description: Any comment related to the content.

tag.name: PLAY_COUNTER
tag.description: The number of times the item has been played.

tag.name: RATING
tag.description: A numeric value defining how much a person likes the song/movie. The number is between 0 and 5, stored using the Float number defined in (#number-tags-formatting) (e.g., 2.7), 5(.0) being the highest possible rating. Other rating systems with different ranges will have to be scaled.

tag.name: ENCODER
tag.description: The software or hardware used to encode this item. ("LAME" or "XviD")

tag.name: ENCODER_SETTINGS
tag.description: A list of the settings used for encoding this item. No specific format.

tag.name: BPS
tag.description: The average bits per second of the specified item stored using the Float number defined in (#number-tags-formatting). This is only the data in the `Block(s)`, and excludes headers and any container overhead.

tag.name: FPS
tag.description: The average frames per second of the specified item. This is typically the average number of Blocks per second stored using the Float number defined in (#number-tags-formatting). In the event that lacing is used, each laced chunk is to be counted as a separate frame.

tag.name: BPM
tag.description: Average number of beats per minute in the complete target (e.g., a chapter) stored using the Float number defined in (#number-tags-formatting).

tag.name: MEASURE
tag.description: In music, a measure is a unit of time in Western music like "4/4". It represents a regular grouping of beats, a meter, as indicated in musical notation by the time signature. The majority of the contemporary rock and pop music you hear on the radio these days is written in the 4/4 time signature.

tag.name: TUNING
tag.description: It is saved as a frequency in hertz to allow near-perfect tuning of instruments to the same tone as the musical piece (e.g., "441.34" in Hertz). The value is stored using the Float number defined in (#number-tags-formatting).

tag.name: REPLAYGAIN_GAIN
tag.description: The gain to apply to reach 89 dB SPL (Sound Pressure Level in decibels) on playback. The value is computed according to the [@!ReplayGain] standard. The value in decibels (dB) is stored as a string (e.g., "-0.42 dB"), using the Float number defined in (#number-tags-formatting). The decibel unit is **OPTIONAL**. There **MAY** be a space between the number and the decibel unit. Note that ReplayGain information can be found at all `TargetType` levels (track, album, etc.).

tag.name: REPLAYGAIN_PEAK
tag.description: The maximum absolute peak amplitude of the item. The value is computed according to the [@!ReplayGain] standard. The value is a normalized absolute sample value of the target audio, using the Float number defined in (#number-tags-formatting) (e.g., "1.0129"). Note that ReplayGain information can be found at all `TargetType` levels (track, album, etc.).

tag.name: EBU_R128_LOUDNESS
tag.description: EBU R 128 Loudness. The value is the Loudness relative to nominal full scale in LUFS (Loudness Units Full Scale) normalized to a Target Level of -23.0 LUFS as defined in [@!EBU-R.128]. This value is stored as a floating-point number in the 32-bit and 64-bit binary interchange format, as defined in [@!IEEE.754]. It is similar to a EBML floating number value [@?RFC8794, section 7.3].

tag.name: EBU_R128_MAX_TRUE_PEAK
tag.description: EBU R 128 Maximum True Peak Level. This corresponds to the maximum value of the audio signal waveform of a programme in the continuous time domain, measured in dB True Peak (dBTP), as defined in [@!EBU-R.128]. This value is stored as a floating-point number in the 32-bit and 64-bit binary interchange format, as defined in [@!IEEE.754]. It is similar to a EBML floating number value [@?RFC8794, section 7.3].

tag.name: EBU_R128_LOUDNESS_RANGE
tag.description: EBU R 128 Loudness Range, measures the variation in a time-varying loudness measurement, in LU (Loudness Units) as defined in [@!EBU-TECH.3342]. This value is stored as a floating-point number in the 32-bit and 64-bit binary interchange format, as defined in [@!IEEE.754]. It is similar to a EBML floating number value [@?RFC8794, section 7.3].

tag.name: EBU_R128_MAX_MOMENTARY_LOUDNESS
tag.description: EBU R 128 Maximum Momentary Loudness, measures the variation of loudness on a 0.4 s sliding rectangular window, in LUFS (Loudness Units Full Scale) as defined in [@!EBU-TECH.3341]. This value is stored as a floating-point number in the 32-bit and 64-bit binary interchange format, as defined in [@!IEEE.754]. It is similar to a EBML floating number value [@?RFC8794, section 7.3].

tag.name: EBU_R128_MAX_SHORT_LOUDNESS
tag.description: EBU R 128 Maximum Short-Term Loudness, measures the variation of loudness on a 3 s sliding rectangular window, in LUFS (Loudness Units Full Scale) as defined in [@!EBU-TECH.3341]. This value is stored as a floating-point number in the 32-bit and 64-bit binary interchange format, as defined in [@!IEEE.754]. It is similar to a EBML floating number value [@?RFC8794, section 7.3].

tag.name: ISRC
tag.description: The International Standard Recording Code [@!ISRC], excluding the "ISRC" prefix and including hyphens.

tag.name: MCDI
tag.description: This is a binary dump of the TOC of the CDROM that this item was taken from. This holds the same information as the "MCDI" in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 50 (ALBUM).

tag.name: ISBN
tag.description: International Standard Book Number [@!ISBN].

tag.name: BARCODE
tag.description: European Article Numbering EAN-13 barcode defined in [@!GS1] General Specifications.

tag.name: CATALOG_NUMBER
tag.description: A label-specific string used to identify the release -- for example, TIC 01.

tag.name: LABEL_CODE
tag.description: A 4-digit or 5-digit number to identify the record label, typically printed as (LC) xxxx or (LC) 0xxxx on CDs medias or covers (only the number is stored).

tag.name: LCCN
tag.description: Library of Congress Control Number [@!LCCN].

tag.name: IMDB
tag.description: Internet Movie Database [@!IMDb] title identifier. "tt" followed by at least 7 digits for Movies, TV Shows, and Episodes.

tag.name: TMDB
tag.description: The Movie DB "movie_id" or "tv_id" identifier for movies/TV shows [@!MovieDB]. The variable length digits string **MUST** be prefixed with either "movie/" or "tv/".

tag.name: TVDB
tag.description: The TV Database "Series ID" or "Episode ID" identifier for TV shows [@!TheTVDB]. Variable length all-digits string identifying a TV Show to use with the "series/{id}" API.

tag.name: TVDB2
tag.description: The TV Database [@!TheTVDB] tag which can include movies. The variable length digits string representing a "Series ID", "Episode ID" or "Movie ID" identifier **MUST** be prefixed with "series/", "episodes/", or "movies/", respectively.

tag.name: PURCHASE_ITEM
tag.description: URL to purchase this file using the URL format defined in [@!RFC3986]. This is akin to the "WPAY" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: PURCHASE_INFO
tag.description: Information on where to purchase this album using the URL format defined in [@!RFC3986]. This is akin to the "WCOM" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: PURCHASE_OWNER
tag.description: Information on the person who purchased the file. This is akin to the "TOWN" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: PURCHASE_PRICE
tag.description: The amount paid for entity, using the Float number defined in (#number-tags-formatting). The currency is not included. For instance, you would store "15.59" instead of "$15.59USD".

tag.name: PURCHASE_CURRENCY
tag.description: The currency type used to pay for the entity. Use [@!ISO4217] for the 3 letter alphabetic code.

tag.name: COPYRIGHT
tag.description: The copyright information as per the copyright holder. This is akin to the "TCOP" tag in [@!ID3v2.3] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: PRODUCTION_COPYRIGHT
tag.description: The copyright information as per the production copyright holder. This is akin to the "TPRO" tag in [@!ID3v2.4] when the `TargetTypeValue` is 30 (TRACK).

tag.name: LICENSE
tag.description: The license applied to the content (e.g., Creative Commons variants).

tag.name: TERMS_OF_USE
tag.description: The terms of use for this item. This is akin to the "USER" tag in [@!ID3v2.3].
